STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 16, 2021
Kyle Rambo
Catholic Social Services of the Upper Peninsula
Suite 215
427 S. Stephenson Ave.
Iron Mountain, MI 49801
RE: License #: CB220201016
Catholic Social Services of the Upper Peninsula
Suite 215
427 S. Stephenson Ave.
Iron Mountain, MI 49801
Dear Mr. Rambo:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
08/11/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or Modified
Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(b) Documentation that the foster parent is willing to accept
the foster child.
One of 3 borrowed foster home files reviewed did not have documentation that the
foster parent was willing to accept the foster child.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One of 3 borrowed foster home files reviewed did not have documentation that the
foster parent has received orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed by
the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One of 3 borrowed foster home files reviewed did not have a copy of the foster
parent /agency agreement signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(3) An agency shall complete a special evaluation within 45
calendar days after receipt of the information. If additional time
is required, then the agency shall inform the foster parent, in
writing, of the basis for the extension and the expected length of
the extension. The total time for the completion of the
4

investigation shall not exceed 90 calendar days without written
approval from the chief administrator or his or her designee.
One of 3 special evaluations reviewed was in MiSACWIS, but not completed. The
special evaluation had an intake date of 04/05/2021 and saved in MiSACWIS on
07/02/2021 but was not completed.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and the needs that remain to
be met.
One of two closed foster care services files did not have a summary of the services
provided during care and the needs that remain to be met.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
One of two closed foster care services files did not have provision for any continuing
services.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is incompliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
5

FOM 722-06H CHILD IN OUT-OFHOME PLACEMENT
The primary caseworker must have face-to-face contact with
each child as indicated below.
First Two Months after Initial Placement or a Placement Change
• The caseworker must have at least two face-to-face contacts
per month with each child in the first two months following an
initial placement or a placement change. •
One of 6 open foster care services files reviewed did not have two face to face
visits per month for two months with the foster child after a change in placement.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
There was not a need for technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The two social service workers at the Iron Mountain office told me that they were not
vaccinated for COVID-19 and they not wearing masks in the office. I suggested they
review CDC recommendations.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan at the interim inspection completed
on September 2, 2020. They were cited for fingerprint training and criminal
clearances in the personnel files. They had a corrective action plan approved on
September 4, 2020 and did not have repeat violations.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
August 12, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 16, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
